verses.kjv: Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.
verses.ct: So you have no excuse, whoever you are, when you pass judgment on someone else. Because when you judge another person, you're actually condemning yourself — since you do the very same things.

verses.kjv: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.
verses.ct: We know that God's judgment against those who practice such things is based on truth.

verses.kjv: And thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them which do such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?
verses.ct: Do you really think, you who judge others for doing these things while doing them yourself, that you will somehow avoid God's judgment?

verses.kjv: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?
verses.ct: Or are you treating his overwhelming kindness, tolerance, and patience with contempt? Don't you realize that God's kindness is meant to lead you toward repentance?

verses.kjv: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;
verses.ct: But because of your stubbornness and your refusal to turn from sin, you are storing up wrath against yourself for the day of wrath, when God's righteous judgment will be revealed.

verses.kjv: Who will render to every man according to his deeds:
verses.ct: He will repay each person according to what they have done.

verses.kjv: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality, eternal life:
verses.ct: To those who persistently do what is good, seeking glory, honor, and immortality, he will give eternal life.

verses.kjv: But unto them that are contentious, and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, indignation and wrath,
verses.ct: But for those who are self-seeking and reject the truth and instead follow unrighteousness, there will be fury and wrath.

verses.kjv: Tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man that doeth evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Gentile;
verses.ct: There will be suffering and distress for every person who does evil — for the Jew first, and also for the Gentile.

verses.kjv: But glory, honour, and peace, to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the Gentile:
verses.ct: But glory, honor, and peace will come to everyone who does what is good — to the Jew first, and also to the Gentile.

verses.kjv: For there is no respect of persons with God.
verses.ct: Because God does not show favoritism.

verses.kjv: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law: and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law;
verses.ct: Everyone who sinned without having the law will also perish apart from the law, and everyone who sinned while having the law will be judged by the law.

verses.kjv: (For not the hearers of the law are just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.
verses.ct: (It's not those who merely hear the law who are righteous in God's sight, but those who actually follow the law who will be declared righteous.

verses.kjv: For when the Gentiles, which have not the law, do by nature the things contained in the law, these, having not the law, are a law unto themselves:
verses.ct: When Gentiles, who don't have the law, instinctively do what the law requires, they become a law for themselves, even though they don't have the law.

verses.kjv: Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)
verses.ct: They demonstrate that the requirements of the law are written on their hearts. Their conscience confirms this, and their own thoughts either accuse them or defend them.)

verses.kjv: In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.
verses.ct: This will become clear on the day when God judges people's hidden lives through Jesus Christ, as my gospel declares.

verses.kjv: Behold, thou art called a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast of God,
verses.ct: Now, you call yourself a Jew. You rely on the law and take pride in your relationship with God.

verses.kjv: And knowest his will, and approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;
verses.ct: You know his will and can determine what is best because you have been taught from the law.

verses.kjv: And art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them which are in darkness,
verses.ct: You are convinced that you are a guide for the blind and a light for those in darkness,

verses.kjv: An instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, which hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law.
verses.ct: an instructor of the ignorant, a teacher of the immature, because you possess the framework of knowledge and truth found in the law.

verses.kjv: Thou therefore which teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?
verses.ct: So then, you who teach others — do you fail to teach yourself? You who preach against stealing — do you steal?

verses.kjv: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?
verses.ct: You who say people should not commit adultery — do you commit adultery? You who despise idols — do you rob temples?

verses.kjv: Thou that makest thy boast of the law, through breaking the law dishonourest thou God?
verses.ct: You who brag about having the law — do you dishonor God by breaking it?

verses.kjv: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you, as it is written.
verses.ct: As Scripture says, "God's name is spoken against among the Gentiles because of you."

verses.kjv: For circumcision verily profiteth, if thou keep the law: but if thou be a breaker of the law, thy circumcision is made uncircumcision.
verses.ct: Circumcision has value if you follow the law, but if you break the law, your circumcision has become as meaningless as being uncircumcised.

verses.kjv: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?
verses.ct: So if an uncircumcised person keeps the requirements of the law, won't their lack of circumcision be regarded as circumcision?

verses.kjv: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfil the law, judge thee, who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law?
verses.ct: The person who is physically uncircumcised but follows the law will condemn you who have the written code and circumcision yet still violate the law.

verses.kjv: For he is not a Jew, which is one outwardly; neither is that circumcision, which is outward in the flesh:
verses.ct: A person is not truly Jewish just because of outward appearance, and real circumcision is not something external and physical.

verses.kjv: But he is a Jew, which is one inwardly; and circumcision is that of the heart, in the spirit, and not in the letter; whose praise is not of men, but of God.
verses.ct: Instead, a true Jew is one on the inside, and real circumcision is a matter of the heart — by the spirit, not by the written code. That person's approval comes not from people, but from God.
